page.title: 07 Farming
page.content:
The farms we visited were Zion's Hill Farm and Manor Farm.
Manor Farm is over 400 acres (19 fields) and grows spring barley and grass. They used to have dairy cattle but now they only have beef. They also keep geese.
Zion's Hill Farm is much smaller with 100 acres. 50 acres of it's land was lost to housing. This farm concentrates on cows and they have 100 mainly Freisian and Limousin.
Both farms use tractors - Manor Farm has two 4 wheels drive ones to use on the rough land. Both farms cut grass for silage.
Both farmers try to be as self-sufficient as they can.
